feature_spans: A/B test dark theme accessibility for users in South Korea. Rollout is limited via GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) and monitored with FR (Feature rollout status) flags.

To comply with the Utah Social Media Regulation Act, we are implementing a curfew-based login restriction for users under 18. The system uses ASL (Age-sensitive logic) to detect minor accounts and routes enforcement through GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) to apply only within Utah boundaries. The feature activates during restricted night hours and logs activity using EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) for auditability. This allows parental control to be enacted without user-facing alerts, operating in ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only) during initial rollout.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_spans: As part of compliance with California’s SB976, the app will disable PF (Personalized feed) by default for users under 18 located in California. This default setting is considered NR (Not recommended (content/user status)) to override, unless explicit parental opt-in is provided. Geo-detection is handled via GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region), and rollout is monitored with FR (Feature rollout status) logs. The design ensures minimal disruption while meeting the strict personalization requirements imposed by the law.

In line with the US federal law requiring providers to report child sexual abuse content to NCMEC, this feature scans uploads and flags suspected materials tagged as T5 (Tier 5 sensitivity data; highly sensitive per internal taxonomy). Once flagged, the CDS (Compliance Detection System) auto-generates reports and routes them via secure channel APIs. The logic runs in real-time, supports human validation, and logs detection metadata for internal audits. Regional thresholds are governed by LCP (Local compliance policy) parameters in the backend.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_spans: To meet the transparency expectations of the EU Digital Services Act, we are introducing a visibility lock for flagged user-generated content labeled under NSP (Non-shareable policy (content should not be shared externally)). When such content is detected, a soft Softblock (User-level limitation applied silently without notifications) is applied and GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) ensures enforcement is restricted to the EU region only. EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) supports traceability, and Redline (Flag for legal review) status can be triggered for legal review. This feature enhances accountability and complies with Article 16’s removal mechanisms.

To support Florida's Online Protections for Minors law, this feature extends the Jellybean (Internal parental control system) parental control framework. Notifications are dispatched to verified parent accounts when a minor attempts to access restricted features. Using IMT (Internal monitoring trigger), the system checks behavioral anomalies against BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) models. If violations are detected, restrictions are applied in ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only) with full audit logging through CDS (Compliance Detection System). Glow (Compliance flagging status used for geo-based alerts) flags ensure compliance visibility during rollout phases.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_spans: Introduce a data retention feature using DRT (Data retention threshold; duration for which logs can be stored) thresholds, ensuring automatic log deletion across all regions. CDS (Compliance Detection System) will continuously audit retention violations, triggering EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) as necessary. Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) logic ensures all platform modules comply uniformly.
reg_snippets: "Social media platforms must disable personalized feeds for users under 18 by default."
"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_spans: This feature will automatically detect and tag content that violates NSP (Non-shareable policy (content should not be shared externally)) policy. Once flagged, Softblock (User-level limitation applied silently without notifications) is applied and a Redline (Flag for legal review) alert is generated if downstream sharing is attempted.

When users report content containing high-risk information, it is tagged as T5 (Tier 5 sensitivity data; highly sensitive per internal taxonomy) for internal routing. CDS (Compliance Detection System) then enforces escalation. The system is universal and does not rely on regional toggles or GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) routes.

Snowcap (Child-safety policy framework) is activated for all underage users platform-wide, applying ASL (Age-sensitive logic) to segment accounts. Actions taken under this logic are routed to CDS (Compliance Detection System) and monitored using BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) to identify deviations in usage.

"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_spans: By default, PF (Personalized feed) will be turned off for all uses browsing in guest mode.

Enable users to reshare stories from others, with auto-expiry after 48 hours. This feature logs resharing attempts with EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) and stores activity under BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection).
Introduce a creator leaderboard updated weekly using internal analytics. Points and rankings are stored in FR (Feature rollout status) metadata and tracked using IMT (Internal monitoring trigger).

Adjust PF (Personalized feed) recommendations based on inferred mood signals from emoji usage. This logic is soft-tuned using BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) and undergoes quiet testing in ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only).
At onboarding, users will receive NR (Not recommended (content/user status))-curated profiles to follow for faster network building. A/B testing will use Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine).

Monetization events will be tracked through CDS (Compliance Detection System) to detect anomalies in creator payouts. DRT (Data retention threshold; duration for which logs can be stored) rules apply for log trimming.

"Providers must implement mechanisms to restrict access to content in compliance with EU law."

feature_spans: Roll out video reply functionality to users in EEA only. GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) will manage exposure control, and BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) is used to baseline feedback.

Launch a PF (Personalized feed) variant in CA as part of early experimentation. Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) will isolate affected cohorts and Glow (Compliance flagging status used for geo-based alerts) flags will monitor feature health.

A new chat layout will be tested in the following regions: CA, US, BR, ID. GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) will ensure location targeting and ShadowMode (Deploy feature in non-user-impact way to collect analytics only) will collect usage metrics without user impact.
Enable video autoplay only for users in US. GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) filters users, while Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) logs click-through deltas.
A/B test dark theme accessibility for users in South Korea. Rollout is limited via GH (Geo-handler; module for routing features by user region) and monitored with FR (Feature rollout status) flags.

Notifications will be tailored by age using ASL (Age-sensitive logic), allowing us to throttle or suppress push alerts for minors. EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification) will log adjustments, and CDS (Compliance Detection System) will verify enforcement across rollout waves.

feature_spans: Introduce limits on video uploads from new accounts. IMT (Internal monitoring trigger) will trigger thresholds based on BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) patterns. These limitations are partly for platform safety but without direct legal mapping.

A flow that detects high-risk comment content and routes it via CDS (Compliance Detection System) with Redline (Flag for legal review) markers. The logic applies generally and is monitored through EchoTrace (Log tracing mode for compliance verification), with no mention of regional policies.

Behavioral scoring via Spanner (Synthetic name for a rule engine) will be used to gate access to certain tools. The feature tracks usage and adjusts gating based on BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) divergence.

We’re expanding chat features, but for users flagged by Jellybean (Internal parental control system), certain functions (e.g., media sharing) will be limited. BB (Baseline behavior used for anomaly detection) and ASL (Age-sensitive logic) will monitor compliance posture.
